channel.title: Jackie Walorski
channel.description: Jackie Walorski Republican Candidate for Congress, Second District of Indiana (Remarks as Prepared for Delivery)

item.title: Good afternoon. I'm proud to represent Indiana, which we affectionately refer to as the Hoosier State.
item.author: Jackie Walorski

item.title: Hoosiers cherish values like common sense, hard work and problem solving.
item.author: Jackie Walorski

item.title: And there's a lot Washington can learn from the Hoosier state.
item.author: Jackie Walorski

item.title: When Indiana faced a massive budget shortfall, we didn't play partisan games. We came together, rolled up our sleeves and turned a billion-dollar deficit into a surplus.
item.author: Jackie Walorski

item.title: We understood that when you have a deficit, spending more money isn't the solution.
item.author: Jackie Walorski

item.title: In the face of record unemployment, we understood that more government spending won't create jobs.
item.author: Jackie Walorski

item.title: That's why we passed common-sense reforms that made it easier to do business ­ and create jobs -- in our great state.
item.author: Jackie Walorski

item.title: As a result, Indiana was rated as the best Midwest state to do business in and we are among the nation's leaders in job growth.
item.author: Jackie Walorski

item.title: In the Hoosier state, we proved a very simple lesson: Working together is the best way to solve our problems. And Washington can do the same.
item.author: Jackie Walorski

item.title: By cutting spending and reducing the red tape, we can unleash our small businesses to create jobs. And with Hoosier common sense, we can balance the budget and get our nation's economy working again.
item.author: Jackie Walorski

item.title: American workers and American entrepreneurs are the best in the world. I'm ready to carry their torch to Washington and prove there will never be a mountain too high for us to climb. The American spirit will always persevere.
item.author: Jackie Walorski

item.title: Fellow Hoosiers it's your time to take back our country.
item.author: Jackie Walorski
